title: EXT_mesh_primitive_edge_visibility glTF extension
description: glTF extension encoding the visibility of the edges of a triangles primitive

visibility.description: The index of the accessor encoding the visibility of each triangle edge as a bitfield with two bits per edge.
visibility.gltf_detailedDescription: An edge visibility of 0 indicates the edge is never drawn; 1 indicates the edge is only drawn in silhouette; 2 indicates the edge is always drawn; and 3 indicates the edge is always drawn and can be drawn by a primitive defined in `primitives`.

silhouetteNormals.description: The index of the accessor encoding the pair of outward-facing normals for the two faces sharing each silhouette edge (visibility 1) encoded in `visibility`.
silhouetteNormals.gltf_detailedDescription: ###TODO. This property **MUST** be defined if `visibility` encodes any edge with visibility value `1`.

primitives.description: An array of primitives defining geometry that renders all of the edges encoded as `3` in `visibility`.
primitives.gltf_detailedDescription: ###TODO. This property **MUST** be defined if `visibility` encodes any edge with visibility value `3`
